newsitem.title: USA: Strong dlr "without question" in US interest - Rubin.
newsitem.headline: Strong dlr "without question" in US interest - Rubin.

text.p: Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin reiterated his support on Tuesday for a strong dollar, saying that "without question" it was in the U.S. interest.
"I believe, without question, a strong dollar is in our interest," he said. "That's our position and continues to be our position."
Rubin said the U.S. economy remained on a "very good track", with economic growth solid and inflation low.
The Treasury chief made his comments in response to questions at a briefing for reporters on the Clinton administration's new plan to help the District of Columbia.
